class iridium_engineering.IridiumReceiverComponent(parent_subsystem: Module, average_power_consumption: float, buffer_capacity: float, health: ComponentHealth = ComponentHealth.NOMINAL, status: ComponentStatus = ComponentStatus.ON, f_update: float = 1)[source]¶

Bases: ComponentModule

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates any thread-sensitive or envent-loop sensitive variables to be used in this module.

async environment_event_handler(event_msg: EnvironmentBroadcastMessage) → bool[source]¶

Affects the component depending on the type of event being received.

is_critical() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is critical.

is_failed() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is a failure state. By default it only considers power supply vs power consumption. Can be extended to add more functionality

async perform_task(task: ComponentTask) → TaskStatus[source]¶

Listens for any incoming transmissions. Needs to be told to start a ReceiveMessageTransmission task from its parent subsystem or CNDH subsystem at the beginning of the simulation otherwise all messages will not be received

class iridium_engineering.IridiumTransmitterComponent(parent_subsystem: Module, average_power_consumption: float, buffer_capacity: float, health: ComponentHealth = ComponentHealth.NOMINAL, status: ComponentStatus = ComponentStatus.OFF, f_update: float = 1)[source]¶

Bases: ComponentModule

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates any thread-sensitive or envent-loop sensitive variables to be used in this module.

async environment_event_handler(event_msg: EnvironmentBroadcastMessage) → bool[source]¶

Affects the component depending on the type of event being received.

async internal_message_handler(msg: InternalMessage)[source]¶

Processes messages being sent to this component. Only accepts task messages.

is_critical() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is critical.

is_failed() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is a failure state. By default it only considers power supply vs power consumption. Can be extended to add more functionality

async perform_task(task: ComponentTask) → TaskStatus[source]¶

Performs a task given to this component. Rejects any tasks if the component is in a failure mode of if it is not intended for to be performed by this component.

async remove_msg_from_buffer(msg: InterNodeMessage)[source]¶
async transmit_message(msg: InterNodeMessage)[source]¶

transmits a message to another agent and returns response from said agent
